values:
Noted lest I forget:
It was a weekend of making out with 4 people.
- the gay work colleague (oops)
- the visiting friend from Canada
- J, who needs a name, and who's either deliberately managing my expectations, or just not fussed enough to respond more quickly than once every 24/48 hours to an email - but who is comfortable and companionable and hot and brain sexy and a source of new ideas (but who doesn't drink this year, or eat dairy, or own more than 1 plate, or, seemingly, have had sex for years before me, or - if I'm being realistic - really want me in his life, despite the fact that I see him as a very good prospective partner)
- the student at the birthday party on Friday night, the kissing outside the bar, the raked fingernails, the hairpulling, the rimming in an alley in a far southern neighborhood til a voyeur (a voyeur!) found us and asked if he could masturbate while watching. This one, yes, this one I should write back and make a date with.

And J I see tonight, hopefully for a bit more clarity on what sort of person I allowed myself to pin hopes to.

Dealing with Echo's relative lack of expressions of desire has been tough - I've been mirroring what I perceive his mood to be, which is usually not-sexy. The discussion we had yesterday - that he is desirous of me, and would take very little when we're entwined to nudge him to fully turned on - was very helpful. Because he does respond beautifully, if inconsistently, to my attempts to make out with him.
Things he's identified as turning him on: 
- kissing him with intent
- hairpulling (hard, so much harder than I would want for myself)
- biting
- expressions of lust for his person at that moment

So given this list, what I need to do is be excited to see him, be excited for the sex we will have, make sure that it happens despite the many shared attractions of the rest of the world, and then make sure more happens - because based on yesterday afternoon, I would have pounced the bejesus of out of him yesterday evening.
The discovery of something good like that encourages me to want significantly more.

Perhaps also: let's drink less, no matter how nice it is.

So if in the future I can trigger mutual lust by being lustful at him, then I should.  More experience and more familiarity should then also help ensure the results are their own reward.

The next step after this: Echo psychology. Discover the physical buttons and psychological levers to play with him, toy with him, the way he does so want to be toyed with.


-

Except for the aggression while biking, he is such a comfortable pleasure to be with.

Thoughts about hanging out with R Sunday and today:

It feels as though R's game for anything I suggest: I can lead him anywhere, and with him following, there isn't anywhere I wouldn't consider going.
It's a delicious dynamic.
Sunday: wandering through ankle deep mud on the marshes to pick nettles for nettle soup
Wednesday: pizza and wine in the centre of a cold, dark innercity park, eventually culminating in kissing, groping, fingering, and a short blowjob in the centre of the park. Next time, I'll be dressed for very discreet fucking there.

Most of this was dealt with via paper journalling, but I spent this past weekend in a foreign city with someone I've developed an 'I want to be you' crush on, at least aesthetically, but who I enjoyed hugely just because he's him.
Things noted:
- the last time I spent 3 days straight with someone I was this excited about, and this intimately involved with, and had this much sex with, was in 2011.
- the sex bit matters hugely. We had 7 sexual encounters (most involving multiple orgasms for both of us) between Friday night and Monday morning. So much appetite for each other. Sleeping spooning and touching; rolling over in the morning to kiss and cuddle and fuck; coming home at night to fuck some more. 
- Casual anal sex! Hurrah for casually, massively experienced partners.
- Massively cheery mood throughout despite only intermittent food: I was running on orgasms. Such powerful mood regulators. 
- Sore abs from the sex; my wistful realization that since L, I haven't had abs like this because I haven't had anyone with this sort of access, matched sex drive, and sheer lustfulness in my life. (I broke up with L in 2011.)
- Dancing. We spent one night partner dancing together. This had felt fairly casually about adventure and sex, and then that happened, and for me, at least, that suddenly felt way more personal, emotional, intimate.
- Most of our sex was without condoms. I've been lax about that recently, which needs to stop, since I apparently regard it as being emotionally significant. I feel bonded to this dude now, which isn't helpful in any way (nor do I believe it's meaningfully reciprocated).
- the lack of verbal feedback on his emotional perception of our interactions isn't actually ok; his comms do a lot of the undermining of my crush (that needs to happen anyway). Gameboy this morning, by contrast, is full of lovely, turning-on words about how much he enjoys me, and being together, and what he thinks of our relationship - and the effect is that I feel I know exactly where I stand, and how to play with him better, and feel immensely safe and comfortable in our friendship.
- I want this sort of comfortable companionship in my daily life. To be less solitary, and more comfortably accompanied by someone I want to fuck like this, who wants to fuck me like this. This is a perfectly sensible thing to want to chase, build, pursue.

From Gameboy, this morning:
"I can control myself when we're out together. But when we're together, like this, [wraps his naked self closer around me] it's like I'm drunk on your skin."

Strangest thing about Trouble being gone from my life: on Monday, I still had someone in it who I enjoyed immensely, who was a font of new ideas and energy and experiences, who enjoyed spending time with me and thought I was someone special. Also: huge amounts of physical contact and sex. Also: a huge sense of potential for more interesting things. 
And it's very odd to have that disappear with one email.

--

Such an enormously powerful creator and consumer of his own reality.

Things not mentioned: the camping/sex weekend was a thing of utter joy. Naked hippies and skinny dipping, lots of stolen snogs from shiny new people. An amazing woman, K, who I've seen once since, and who I'll see again on Friday. Spending a night cuddled with Gameboy. Camping in a beautifully outdoorsy location. The best place I've been in a very, very long time.

It's probably time I wrote about J, since that hasn't happened yet. I met him on the 12th, which is less than 3 weeks ago. Meeting him has been fairly intense - the depth of my comfort around him, the easy familiarity (certainly with his body) suggests a much, much longer relationship.
J's easily the highest octane person I've ever been involved with. He's ferociously intelligent, warm, social and very, very personable. He's tactile, sensual like I am - we tend to spend our time together touching each other, a lot. From the start, fucking him has felt intensely intimate, as if we're trying to have bonding sex. Lots of gentle touching while staring into each other's eyes. Our kink seems to mesh. There's been a discussion (and some practice) of going bareback with each other since the day we met, when I took him home.
And the other high octane part: it doesn't sound as if he's ever had a single relationship that ended amicably - it sounds like he normally travels through people's lives as an emotional wrecking ball. He's probably earning an order of magnitude more than I was last year, and consumes accordingly. And this is before you get to the hedonism: the nearly daily drug use, the partying. Both of the latter feed my own 'let's try everything' tendency, so our time together tends to feel creative, spontaneous, energetic, adventurous and exploratory.
And my intuitive, gut feeling is to trust him with my physical safety. I'm entirely, wholly safe with him. I'm just not safe emotionally from him. It's an interesting tension.
The result? 
We've evolved a dynamic where we try to show each other new things, either in the city or in life. He's 15 years older than me; it feels like he has a headstart. I've lived in this half of the city for four years now, and know so much more about it than him, a recent transplant. We're both plugged into different worlds culturally, so have a different list of lectures and events to go to. Both interested in learning, experiencing.
And he's decided that he'd like to push my horizons, which is the flip side of my decision that I liked that he would push my horizons.
New things tried so far:
- ketamine
- Hitachi magic wand
- nitrous
- e-stim buttplug
- a really intense scene involving my being blindfolded, restrained, the e-stim buttplug, feathers(?) and ice cream, pinching, slapping, a vibrator and the magic wand, and lots of finger fucking, kissing, sensory overload.
That's in 2.5 weeks.
What I don't want: for this to evolve into a non-balanced power dynamic. It already feels like there's a potential for that to happen, for it to settle into an older, wiser, more experienced dom with a willing pupil.
Fuck that.
My exit condition, I suppose, will be the day it feels like he's not learning from me, or no longer wants to. That's when this will tip into massively unequal, and I don't want to be in that relationship. Especially not with him.
I'm also concerned I won't be able to keep up with him, but that's something that will become clear (or not) over time, rather than right now.
For the moment, there seems to be mutual excitement at each other, comfort, sensual pleasures, and adventures to be had. The trick will be to keep the excitement proportional - already, I suspect I've been more articulate about the way I enjoy his company. If he's not exactly onboard there (his joke yesterday about my being 'an old romantic'), then this could be a problem. I refuse to be another in the series of ladies who've just fallen for him.
And so long as I'm playing with the power dynamic, discovery of more things that make him a hopeless jelly would be good.
---
Thought: I currently have a sex life (a rollicking, many-partnered sex life), but no love life. I've always been for disaggregating the two, but having someone in my life who I would want for my love life (and J is too unreliable, too clearly looking for something other than what I am) would be a good start.

I'm loving this today:
http://pinterest.com/pin/113856696802139744/

Also: mass camping/playparty this weekend. Very exciting stuff.

On the plus side, I got to make out with two different people Thurs and Fri, and Gameboy and I have decided over Friday lunch that our friendship probably can stretch to include sex, as a cosy, friendly, comforting thing, which is very exciting indeed.  I'm home the next few weeks, and would like most of all to see about setting up more casual sexual encounters, more people to be interested in getting to know, to explore, more people to be excited about in a post-S London life.
And I hope to go to a playparty on Sat, which should be very good for getting my flirt on, and hopefully my lust on.
The plan is to rewire my interest in fucking strangers - whittle down the need for an intellectual/emotional attraction, and enjoy the sensuality.

So the missing him is real; masturbating to his text messages yesterday was incredibly fucking hot, but left me bereft. Devastated.
All of the not voraciously devouring, cataloguing, possessing, collecting every remaining scrap of our time together - yesterday afternoon was when I finally had that impulse. The need to write down the words he used ("when you give me those big kisses", "I want to have angry sex with you"), some memory of comfort and ease in everything, including walking to the gas station together Tuesday night for food, the feel of his forehead against my cheek as we stroke and rub but do not kiss - all these were wonderful, and could make me crazy possessive. 
Instead, I sound trite to myself.
The best way to deal is - as discussed with S - to view this as a grieving process. To fill my life with things that don't touch on him, for which he has no context.  And really, it's easy, because he does have no context in my life; there's never been any Simon-shaped space in my life, although all our wandering through the city centre has changed my psychogeography there.  Biking along the river bank to fly to him Wednesday night felt meet and just - that's where we wandered the first time we met.  It felt appropriate that the relationship should end with my passing through there as well.
Insofar as this has ended.
The correct way to mourn is to create a new present, locating the missed person in the past. Eventually you'll fill your life up without them.  Each text we exchange, especially the ones in which casually and glancingly reference the emotions we're having, undoes that.  Him telling me he misses me, and apologising for it.  That doesn't help.
Hopefully he'll get busy and stop talking (I don't actually hope this), as that would be one of the easiest ways to deal. A slow tailing off and slipping away and scabbing over.
I can fill my life without any problems - it's the private memory of Simon in the interstices, the wild joy at interacting with him - it's this that needs to fade. To somehow transition him to flirty friend, that one-time four-night-stand, rather than that person I fell for (how hard?) who's now very far away. 
Or better yet: to have the memories obliterated by a wild love affair with someone just as or more compelling. That would be best.  Can you get on it, universe?

Housemate says I have a different air about me - something has absolutely changed. She thinks it's happiness.

1) Broke up with G on Wednesday, due to the opportunity costs of our never-amazing, always comfortable mismatch.
2) Lovely weekend as always with D, including one oral/vaginal session which definitely saw me come, oh, 7 times? D's wonderfully bloodyminded about that, and I love being puddly orgasmic mush in his oh-so-clever hands (and tongue and cock.)  We've evolved into something very comfortable; I believe we slept about 20 hours together this weekend.
3) Brought home a random last night - a 99% match on OkC. He's tribe - an intuitively good fit socially and culturally, a bit like coming home. Unexpectedly ferocious, devouring make outs - hands everywhere gripping, kissing as if necessary for breathing.  Very very hot, and plugs in with my kinks perfectly.  We're less well-matched in bed, however - I get the impression he gets off on foreplay, and then actually gets off within minutes when there's penetrative sex involved.  It was a bit disappointing, though I don't think we're actually incompatible - I could probably get off on his style of foreplay if I were more aggressive about ensuring it was mutually masturbatory, or if I could slow him down enough to focus on me and where I'm at (slower than where he was, and, surprisingly, gentler.)
We'll see if he ever writes me back; we'd verbally mentioned meeting up again sometime next week.
But hurrah for the spontaneity of bringing a random home with me, and hurrah for what was easily the most world-consuming kissing I've had in 2013 (and possibly 2012.)  Hurra for meeting people who could actually be dangerous to my equilibrium; who do conceivably have lifelong potential, rather than just this month.
Now: bedtime again, to catch up on sleep lost last night.

Crystallizing a sexual encounter with my Oglaf boy this weekend, some ongoing peculiarity with G, and a chat with the Canadian: I think I want my lovers to know they're mine, wholeheartedly. To recognise that in me, they've got something fucking wonderful, and when they're with me, it will be fucking amazing. That interesting things will deliberately and purposefully happen (even if that's through creating the space for well-resourced spontaneity.) The Canadian gets this; my impression is still that I'm one of the few people allowed to totally bully him into doing things that are good for him, that he's comfortable being utterly silly and confused around, because it's safe. G is way way more subby than I'm used to, but I suspect that if we continue as at present, he will get it. I suspect I need to back off a bit from an emotional escalation perspective (and my travel schedule will do that automagically), but looking at the way we interact together, the levels of intertwined mutual care demonstrated, and the things he's learnt or started doing since meeting me (that he wasn't initially) - I do suspect this thing has legs.* And in return, I want someone to rough me up, to hold me down, to playfight with me in bed. Toss me around physically out of love because I enjoy it, and I know you want it just as much as I do. This comes from fucking D again this weekend, and noticing just how incredibly turned on I am when he pins my elbows down while eating me out, my arching up to be closer to him. And Sunday, just how enormously, gushingly wet I got when he flipped me on to my stomach, stuck his massive cock into me, pushed my legs shut, twisted my arms behind my back so I could play with his nipples while he fucked me, each rockhard thrust ramming my buttplug as well. Being pinned under him while he fucked me and pulled me towards him by my hair, holding me at the throat was fucking hot; my nipples are hard writing about it now. This despite one of my shoulders being far too stiff to bend, and the throatgrabbing being on the edge of a hard boundary (breathplay is not a thing I'm into.) And this takes me to G, whose ass I've been finger fucking and recently dildo fucking (and hope to peg soon, and oh my how good my fingers feel in his ass), and who doesn't do pain at the minute (giving or receiving). Based on how much better the sex we're having is for me (he's gotten much better at rhythms that work for me; initially he seemed almost random, with frequent changes), I have high hopes I can teach him that this is also something I like, and that I will respond very well to the occasional bite or push. Curiously, based on the dynamic we have, I think this will still have to be within a context in which I take the initiative - in which I make sure things happen for him sexually, or in which I am the one directing the sexual experience. This does seem to be what gets him going, though I'd love to know more about the psychology of what's pushing his buttons. I think he appreciates my desire for some mutuality, but that's it not quite what's most effective for him. We recently had a night where, at his request, I poured syrup all over him, and licked some of it off, and washed the rest. He indicated that he liked the mess, but that it was much less functional (more sticky) than anticipated. My next adventures in that direction will probably be other messy things that are less predictable (port and candlewax, taking me back literally a decade to Wren.) He's also indicated an interest in the squirminess of unexpectedly encountering a filthy photo of him in a public place, say the internet - which means I should get my camera fixed, and ponder how to interrupt sex to take filthy photos of him. (Talk about a statement of power...but then, I suspect my fucking his ass with a dildo was as well for him? I need him to talk more.) *G: didn't like people breathing on him the first night we slept together. We were allowed to spoon briefly while awake, and then had to separate. He's now started sleeping, oh, 15 cm from me - at least, that's where he is when I wake up - and he's no longer waking up in the night, while I still am with him.

Finally, I spent yesterday mooching about with the Canadian, and confirmed (again, still) that my main response to him is just joy and lust.  I do enjoy him so, and he doesn't seem to mind my company (if him finding excuses for me not to leave are any evidence...)
The contrast between my interest in him (and joy in spending time with him, and the flirt I get on when we hang out), and nearly everyone else by contrast is...illuminating.  There's people I could fuck in my life, but none who get me buzzing quite the way he does, even now.  I'll soon be reaching the point where I'd like some physical contact now already please, and a short survey of who's currently in my life suggests that it's going to have to be with someone I'm not interested in like that.
This is disappointing.

Oh, and G is now number 32.  I'd like to think that has potential, (it felt like there was chemistry!) but our contact is too infrequent for intimacy, and possibly too infrequent for desire on my part.  The situation with the other lady is also alienating me; my plan is to buy Tweetbot so I can actually mute all her tweets relating to her lovers, because if I'm right that he's one of them, then I really don't need that level of information at all.
We do sleep disastrously together, which could be a dealbreaker in itself.

Since my evening plan (G) has been postponed, the obvious course of action this afternoon after catching up on all of the Oglaf was to rub out a quick one myself. 
Two related thoughts:
1) I'm about to wash my sheets - I love how cum stained they are.  It's all from masturbation (sadly), but the traces of my frequent pleasure are all there.
2) The thoughts that made me come today? Being restrained and promised that I would now be fucked by four separate people - and the squirmy knowledge that there's nothing I can do but enjoy the ride As. Much. As. Possible.
Bit subby, that.  But oh! What a quick orgasm.

I think this is the first time in a long time that I've kissed three people in one day in a non-orgy setting.  
D, L and Gameboy.  Wooo!
Also, I believe I'm up to 31 partners now - A, who I haven't mentioned or written about at all, was my random fuck of Friday a week ago, and D the Australian at the play party was my number 30.

Great excitement tonight: I kissed Gameboy! The one I've been flirting with gently (quietly, gently, apparently successfully) since July, but who's too socially valuable to actually do anything with (which he agrees with.)  The one I've been coaching on how to be better at poly since July , and who I've listened to carefully as he discusses his recent forays into the kink world, and exploring how that's working for him...listened carefully as he's explained just how fucking compatible he'd be with me sexually if only he knew.  And have said NOTHING, because he's off limits, and it's simply not useful for him to know.
Fuck, he was fun to kiss.
Also, yes, there will be more kissing, and probably some fucking if we can discuss a way to get me comfortable with the fact that he apparently falls for anyone he fucks.  (Which, um, not acceptable given that we both agreed the other should be off limits.)
Currently, however, I'm a little bit giddy from a deliciously gropey make-out session in my hallway, and from the knowledge that someone does want to kiss me, seemingly quite a bit.  Someone I rather like, too.  That's exciting.
--
And tomorrow: my second date with G, the man who after last Wednesday's first date had me stuck on The Beards' "You should consider having sex with a bearded man" for the next two days.  His way with words has me craving more; he's managing playful; fantastically, unexpectedly witty; ever so flattering.  I'm rather excited for this, too.
G's segue into kissing last week, when I presented him with a conversational fork and asked him to pick which he was more interested in: "well, on a continuum of interest from [this] to [this] - because I'm interested in everything - what I'm most interested in is what it would be like to kiss you."
*melt*
So we did.
I spent Thurs-Sat completely starstruck about G, more than a bit of a crush, and then talked myself down by Sunday (after a weekend with D&L, including lots of lovely L kisses, and some quite intense being fucked in the ass by D, including my having an awesome clitoral orgasm while his pornstar cock was as deep in my ass as I was comfortable with.)
But back to crushland, his texts this afternoon have been quite flattering, so...yeah.  Warm fuzzy glow off him as well.  And hopefully even more of one tomorrow - the place we're meeting is conveniently close to his house.  (And I'm, damnably, on my period - Gameboy offered to stay tonight as well, and I chose to send him home, both like a responsible adult who knows he's off limits, and like a lazy person who doesn't want to deal with the mess, and any possible hangups about mess, the first time.)
---
Finally, Simon actually communicated interest, in a series of drunken texts Friday night.  Also someone I first met in July, and also someone who, like Gameboy, I suspect would be a lot of fun to fuck.  Also, not my highest priority at the moment (as G is will hopefully live up to all my crushing expectations tomorrow, and continue to be properly shiny, while it would be lovely to continue in some way with Gameboy, and thus declare that out of our systems - though if I'm being realistic, I doubt that would happen.  More realistic would be that we agreed we were adults, and that we're off limits to each other, and we'll seal it with a long kiss.)

First, this made me smile just now: 
http://pervertsofcolor.tumblr.com/image/33588235305
Next: there's a new crop of people to add to my spreadsheet! Apparently I'm back in 'single and willing to fuck just about anybody casually' mode.  This is alright, but I suspect that I'm generally much happier (especially emotionally) when I'm having meaningful sex with someone I really like - rather than mediocre sex with people I'm okay with, but don't desperately desperately want.
I'll keep y'all posted if either the sex gets better, or someone important comes along.
(Supposedly I have an OkCupid date tomorrow or Weds, but he's not being very responsive, which seems like a poor sign.)

After dancing with a friend tonight, someone asked who had been leading.  'Both of us!', we laughed. Thinking it over, however, I default to leading to keep it interesting for me...until shown that someone is more/differently experienced than me, at which point I will gladly cede the lead until I have something else to share again.
This totally applies to how I approach sex.

(This is, of course, why I don't identify as a conventional dom or sub.)

So, jotting it down because it's still weirding me out slightly: I woke up last night mid-dream due to the wrongness of it.  The dream was about fucking my dad, which, yeah, wrong.  I'm going to assume it's either because I fucked a dude with a lovely beard on Sat (at a sex party, which was going to be its own entry), or just because my brain pings on random while dreaming, and there's not much I can do about it.  I do wish my brain hadn't given me this dream, however, especially the details about my dad's penis.
(My dad's been dead for years, and I dream about him very infrequently.  Most dreams about him are positive or sad, but not weird.)

This is awesome:
http://stoya.tumblr.com/post/28527362494/hysterical-literature
(Watch the movie first.)
Also: the best description of love I've encountered in a long time:
http://www.zefrank.com/zesblog/archives/2012/08/job_interview.html

Fucking Canadian. (In tones of exasperation, as ever.)
I had my relationship chat with him (via IM) - his best answer for why he decided to stop dating me was that the bad/no sex was making him feel awful (yup, me too), and the anticipation that saying goodbye to me would be too much to deal with, given that he was still upset from saying goodbye to his entire life in Canada.  And that he then got busy and fucked up communicating this to me, and that he should have realized this wasn't the way to do it (no SHIT.)
Anyway, I think we're sorted now - he's said very clearly that I did nothing wrong, and he doesn't hate me, both of which have been super reassuring to hear, if hyperbolic in the extreme. He's under instructions to give me any feedback he comes up with, though I'm not holding my breath.
We may even meet up again at some point, though I won't have time til after I get back from D's wedding in 10 days.

I have just emailed the Canadian asking him to have a chat with me at some point about why we broke up, because I still don't know when/why he lost interest/quit me as a priority/what went wrong (or not?) from his perspective.  And I'd like some feedback, in some way, because this has been one of the most amorphously unsatisfying, intangible but stressful breakups I've ever had - feeling unwanted and forgotten sucks, and if I can possibly avoid it in the future, I will.
And even now, the emotion writing my very short, very neutral note has unleashed has me incredibly tense and shaking.  Because we now interact on a daily basis as if we're friendly, and I could easily* be friends with him - but knowing why we're not dating is important to whether I want to be friends with him.  Because I may very well not, based on the way he's dealt with this, no matter how brilliantly we have gotten along in the past.
--
My own insight of earlier this week: categorizing my lovers, some have been for fun, and some have been for intensely serious real.  The fun ones I don't fall in love with; the for real ones I'm exceptionally picky about, and then exceptionally loyal.  And from the start, I think T wanted/needed to be treated as for fun; he's only here for a short while, he's in the middle of enormous personality shift/maturation/change (though I suspect he'll only really become aware of how much he's changed when he goes back to Canada in December), and dating someone seriously is probably just not what he wanted.  I certainly don't think he wanted me in his life.**  The bit that makes me bitter, the bit I probably never communicated to him, is that he pushes enough of my buttons that he did veer into real - without pushing them especially well, or without pushing all of them.  This was always a relationship that was going to get better (I sincerely hoped) or fizzle out (what happened). For my own priorities, I would rather have 8 months of torrid love affair than not, and I was ready with a lot of my time, energy and attention to make that happen. And he wasn't.
Main plan for now: focus carefully on the fun and real categories. Perhaps make a point of seeking out someone real who wants to BE someone real for me; I suspect that would make me much happier in the long run than all the for-funs put together. That sense of being loved up I got with H and L is unbeatable for my joie d'vivre, health and self-esteem, and that's worth chasing. Insofar as I have a 10 year plan (I don't), finding a long term partner is part of it, the sort of person I could potentially even want to spawn with. (This is the first time I've ever put /that/ on paper! But this morning was the first time I've ever felt the need to take a pregnancy test, so hurrah for more firsts...)
So yes, more for funs in my life (always), but make sure the categories are, and stay, very very clear.
Especially to me.


*I still feel like I know him exceptionally well, and I run into at least one thing a day that I know will make him smile or laugh.
**Someone pointed out to me yesterday that maybe he's just more comfortable being miserable. I have trouble believing this (don't want to believe this?), but at least it would be familiar for him.

I'm coming to accept that the song that I have stuck in my head for days on end is usually there because it's resonating in some important way; it's often what a movie soundtrack to my life would be playing.
These past two weeks, the main song has been Ok Go's 'A million ways' - "Oh such grace, oh such beauty, lipstick and callous and fishnets and malice. Oh darling, you're a million ways to be cruel".
And the past few days?  Simon & Garfunkel's "Song for the Asking".  So full of hope, so full of offering myself to the world.  Love me, please?

The last few days I've been emailing/chatting with the Canadian again; I've been feeling sufficiently over him that I could do it, and he seems to be welcoming the contact as well.
And then I dreamt about him just now.  A roadtrip through mountains with him, one of his friends, and some random person of mine (family?), and moved by the mountains, overcome by my proximity, or whatever implausible reason, we ended up snuggling the whole way, him reaching out to hold me, me stopping to stroke him - sharing lots of moments.  In my dream, he wanted me again.
Oh brain, why?  This is super unhelpful.  I know I really rather liked him; I know he's checked out of my life without telling me why; I know there was a giant stew of hurt and rejection and longing...and I thought I'd moved on even slightly from that.  Regained some poise and equanimity, armored myself with all the reasons why dating him was terrible for me, and decided that not dating me was his loss, his problem that his walnut brain couldn't handle emotions.
Please don't do this again, brain?  Because I'm not sure I can handle too many more of these dreams.  I don't want to have to.
